lines.text: Enter EDGAR

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: Yet better thus, and known to be contemn'd, Than still contemn'd and flatter'd. To be worst, The lowest and most dejected thing of fortune, Stands still in esperance, lives not in fear: The lamentable change is from the best; The worst returns to laughter. Welcome, then, Thou unsubstantial air that I embrace! The wretch that thou hast blown unto the worst Owes nothing to thy blasts. But who comes here? My father, poorly led? World, world, O world! But that thy strange mutations make us hate thee, Lie would not yield to age.
Enter GLOUCESTER, led by an Old Man

lines.speaker: old man
lines.text: O, my good lord, I have been your tenant, and your father's tenant, these fourscore years.

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: Away, get thee away; good friend, be gone: Thy comforts can do me no good at all; Thee they may hurt.

lines.speaker: old man
lines.text: Alack, sir, you cannot see your way.

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: I have no way, and therefore want no eyes; I stumbled when I saw: full oft 'tis seen, Our means secure us, and our mere defects Prove our commodities. O dear son Edgar, The food of thy abused father's wrath! Might I but live to see thee in my touch, I'ld say I had eyes again!

lines.speaker: old man
lines.text: How now! Who's there?

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: [Aside]  O gods! Who is't can say 'I am at the worst'? I am worse than e'er I was.

lines.speaker: old man
lines.text: 'Tis poor mad Tom.

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: [Aside]  And worse I may be yet: the worst is not So long as we can say  'This is the worst.'

lines.speaker: old man
lines.text: Fellow, where goest?

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: Is it a beggar-man?

lines.speaker: old man
lines.text: Madman and beggar too.

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: He has some reason, else he could not beg. I' the last night's storm I such a fellow saw; Which made me think a man a worm: my son Came then into my mind; and yet my mind Was then scarce friends with him: I have heard more since. As flies to wanton boys, are we to the gods. They kill us for their sport.

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: [Aside] How should this be? Bad is the trade that must play fool to sorrow, Angering itself and others.--Bless thee, master!

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: Is that the naked fellow?

lines.speaker: old man
lines.text: Ay, my lord.

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: Then, prithee, get thee gone: if, for my sake, Thou wilt o'ertake us, hence a mile or twain, I' the way toward Dover, do it for ancient love; And bring some covering for this naked soul, Who I'll entreat to lead me.

lines.speaker: old man
lines.text: Alack, sir, he is mad.

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: 'Tis the times' plague, when madmen lead the blind. Do as I bid thee, or rather do thy pleasure; Above the rest, be gone.

lines.speaker: old man
lines.text: I'll bring him the best 'parel that I have, Come on't what will.
Exit

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: Sirrah, naked fellow,--

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: Poor Tom's a-cold. I cannot daub it further.
Aside

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: Come hither, fellow.

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: [Aside]  And yet I must.--Bless thy sweet eyes, they bleed.

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: Know'st thou the way to Dover?

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: Both stile and gate, horse-way and foot-path. Poor Tom hath been scared out of his good wits: bless thee, good man's son, from the foul fiend! five fiends have been in poor Tom at once; of lust, as Obidicut; Hobbididence, prince of dumbness; Mahu, of stealing; Modo, of murder; Flibbertigibbet, of mopping and mowing, who since possesses chambermaids and waiting-women. So, bless thee, master!

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: Here, take this purse, thou whom the heavens' plagues Have humbled to all strokes: that I am wretched Makes thee the happier: heavens, deal so still! Let the superfluous and lust-dieted man, That slaves your ordinance, that will not see Because he doth not feel, feel your power quickly; So distribution should undo excess, And each man have enough. Dost thou know Dover?

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: Ay, master.

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: There is a cliff, whose high and bending head Looks fearfully in the confined deep: Bring me but to the very brim of it, And I'll repair the misery thou dost bear With something rich about me: from that place I shall no leading need.

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: Give me thy arm: Poor Tom shall lead thee.
Exeunt
